name: Thomas DeLorme’s APRE 10RM — 4-Set Autoregulated (11 min per session)
time_per_session_breakdown: Set 1 (~30-45s + 1m rest), Set 2 (~30-45s + 1m rest), Set 3 (~30-45s + 2-3m rest), Set 4 (~30-45s + 3-5m rest) ≈ 11 min total
overview_and_execution: Perform four sets. Sets 1-2 are lighter (50% and 75% of your estimated 10RM). Set 3 is an AMRAP at your 10RM. Based on reps completed in Set 3, adjust the weight for the next session. Set 4 uses the newly adjusted load to finish the session. Rest 1 minute between early sets, then 2-5 minutes before heavier sets.
example_application: If your estimated 10RM for squats is 200 lb, do Set 1: 12 reps at ~100 lb, Set 2: 10 reps at ~150 lb, Set 3: AMRAP at 200 lb. If you get 12 reps, next time add 5-10 lb for the 10RM set. Then Set 4 uses that adjusted weight.
important_notes: Choose an accurate 10RM. Avoid grinding reps; adjust weight up or down based on performance in Set 3. Rest more before heavier sets. This method reduces the need for scheduled deloads.
volume_metrics: 4 working sets total per exercise, typically 10-12 reps on early sets plus an AMRAP and a final heavy set
